attributes.action: MPs poor behaviour to be sanctioned in the same way as other public leaders.
attributes.additional_details: Behaviour of MPs in public and in the House must be challenged and sanctioned, by a panel of public leaders (eg. heads, doctors etc). This panel needs the power to sanction or remove MPs from office for financial irregularity, lying, or racist, sexist, homophobic, abusive, violent, discriminatory, anti-social or anti-semitic behaviour. All incidents and sanctions should be made public with MP's voting records, so voters can see if their MP shows the morality and integrity worthy of their vote.
attributes.background: The behaviour of some MPs is a national and international disgrace, and the current arrangements with the House of Commons monitoring itself are utterly ineffective. Behaviour that would result in members of the general public losing their jobs is ignored in MPs. These double standards must cease.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. There is already an independent Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards, and the Standards Committee includes lay members. The Committee has the power to recommenda sanctions, and all its reports are made public. You can find out more about the Parliamentary Standards system here:

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/standards-and-financial-interests/parliamentary-commissioner-for-standards/

You could start a new petition asking for all members of the Standards Committee to be members of the public, if that's what you'd like to see happen.
